title: Robert Tchenguiz offloads Leeds government office
text:
Property tycoon Robert Tchenguiz has added £250m to his comeback war chest after selling the NHS’s HQ in Leeds, part of a wider plan to top up his coffers following the end of a lengthy legal saga.

Mr Tchenguiz has sold the iconic Quarry House in Leeds for £246m to Legal & General, the most achieved for the sale of an individual property outside of London.

The 375,000 sq ft building, one of the NHS’s key hubs, has been owned by Mr Tchenguiz’s ­investment fund for almost two decades. Sources said the sale took place as the Iranian-born billionaire aims to create a “large cash pool” so he can pour money into new UK properties.

“He is reviewing a number of properties to buy,” a source close to him...
description: Property tycoon Robert Tchenguiz has added £250m to his comeback war chest after selling the NHS’s HQ in Leeds, part of a wider plan to top up his coffers following the end of a lengthy legal saga.
